content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <rdf:RDF xmlns:rdf="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#" xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:syn="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/syndication/" xmlns="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/">             <channel rdf:about="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/featured-links/RSS">   <title>Featured links</title>   <link>http://www.ecn.ac.uk</link>    <description>            Featured links        </description>                     <syn:updatePeriod>daily</syn:updatePeriod>             <syn:updateFrequency>1</syn:updateFrequency>             <syn:updateBase>2010-09-11T14:21:18Z</syn:updateBase>             <image rdf:resource="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/logo.png"/>    <items>     <rdf:Seq>                <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/ecosystems-knowledge-network"/>                       <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/expeer"/>                       <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/interact"/>                       <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/newp"/>                       <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/defra-ccra"/>            </rdf:Seq>   </items>  </channel>     <item rdf:about="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/ecosystems-knowledge-network">     <title>Ecosystems Knowledge Network</title>     <link>http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/ecosystems-knowledge-network</link>     <description>The Ecosystems Knowledge Network is a resource for anyone wanting to share knowledge or learn about the practical benefits of an ecosystems approach. It draws together experience from the UK and elsewhere to assist organisations to understand how a 'whole ecosystem' approach can help us build sustainable communities.</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>link-set:featured</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>link-set:policy</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2012-05-28T12:45:00Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>Link</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/expeer">     <title>ExpeER</title>     <link>http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/expeer</link>     <description>ExpeER (Experimentation in Ecosystem Research) is a major European Infrastructure project (2010-2014) in the field of Ecosystem Research. ExpeER will, for the first time, federate existing national infrastructures, improve their research capacity whilst at the same time facilitating access to those key experimental and observational platforms as well as analytical and modelling facilities for the benefit of the international research community.</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>link-set:featured</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>link-set:other</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2013-04-10T13:04:59Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>Link</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/interact">     <title>INTERACT</title>     <link>http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/interact</link>     <description>INTERACT is an infrastructure project under the auspices of SCANNET, a circumarctic network of 33 terrestrial field bases in northern Europe, Russia, US, Canada, Greenland, Iceland, the Faroe Islands and Scotland. INTERACT specifically seeks to build capacity for research and monitoring in the European Arctic and beyond, and is offering access to numerous research stations through the Transnational Access program. </description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>link-set:env-monitoring</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>link-set:featured</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2011-08-26T15:15:00Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>Link</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/newp">     <title>Natural Environment White Paper</title>     <link>http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/newp</link>     <description>The Natural Environment White Paper is a bold and ambitious statement outlining the Government\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds vision for the natural environment over the next 50 years, backed up with practical action to deliver that ambition.</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>link-set:featured</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>link-set:policy</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2012-11-26T14:10:00Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>Link</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/defra-ccra">     <title>UK Climate Change Risk Assessment: Government Report</title>     <link>http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/defra-ccra</link>     <description>The Government published the UK Climate Change Risk Assessment (CCRA) on 25 January 2012, the first assessment of its kind for the UK and the first in a 5 year cycle. It sets out the main priorities for adaptation in the UK under 5 key themes identified in the CCRA 2012 Evidence Report \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Agriculture and Forestry; Business, industries and Services; Health and Wellbeing; Natural Environment and Buildings and Infrastructure \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd and describes the policy context, and action already in place to tackle some of the risks in each area. It highlights the constraints of the CCRA analysis and provides advice on how to take account of the uncertainty within the analysis.</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>link-set:featured</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>link-set:policy</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2012-11-26T13:55:00Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>Link</dc:type>   </item>      </rdf:RDF>
